FuncDef:
The priority 8021p command sets an 802.1p priority value for generalflow test packets in an Ethernet scenario.
The undo priority command restores the default 802.1p priority value.
By default, the 802.1p priority value is 0.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the 802.1p priority value for generalflow test packets.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To modify the 802.1p priority for generalflow test packets in an Ethernet scenario, run the priority 8021p command.
Prerequisites
The priority 8021p command can only be used for generalflow test instances in an Ethernet scenario.
Precautions
You cannot change this configuration of a running test instance.
